results.firPara: Manchester United have accepted a £22m bid from Everton for Morgan Schneiderlin, which could rise to £24m with add-ons.
results.secPara: Ronald Koemans opening offer of £19m for the France midfielder was rejected last week, and West Bromwich Albion also saw a similar offer turned down with United keen to recoup the £24m fee they paid Southampton for Schneiderlin in July 2015.
results.webTitle: Everton’s £22m Morgan Schneiderlin bid accepted by Manchester United

results.firPara: Brentford are determined not to sell Scott Hogan for less than their £15m valuation after rejecting West Hams latest offer worth up to £12.5m for the striker.
results.secPara: Slaven Bilic is desperate to add to his attacking options with Italy forward Simone Zaza likely to leave the club this month and Diafra Sakho still out injured. Having made an unofficial enquiry at the start of the month, West Hams first official bid of £9m was rejected last week and they returned with an improved offer of £10m before the weekend.
results.webTitle: Brentford turn down £12.5m from West Ham United for striker Scott Hogan

results.firPara: • Senegal striker has been frozen out of first team at Goodison Park
results.secPara: Hull City have agreed a loan with Everton for Oumar Niasse until the end of the season, when they will have the option to make the deal permanent for a fee of £10m.
results.webTitle: Hull agree loan deal for Everton’s Oumar Niasse with £10m option to buy

results.firPara: In todays Fiver the World Cup, a Craig David tribute and Malaysian inspiration
results.secPara: In todays Fiver the World Cup, a Craig David tribute and Malaysian inspiration
results.webTitle: The Fiver | Ultra-defensive snoozefests between wildly-mismatched opponents

results.firPara: What do you think about Fifas plan to expand the tournament from 2026?
results.secPara: • Fifas plan explained how the 48-team format will work
results.webTitle: Is the 48-team World Cup a good idea?

results.firPara: It is still less than a year since Gianni Infantino stood dazzled by destiny at the Fifa congress, tapping his heart in disbelief at really being the president, and already he has swept in the historic, bulky change of a 48-country World Cup. It comes as no surprise, really, that having made it his pitch for votes to expand the World Cup, as he stepped over the fallen careers of his banned former boss at Uefa, Michel Platini, and Fifas Sepp Blatter, Infantino has quickly steered through that promise.
results.secPara: With this crowding of 16 more countries into the flagship summer tournament, Europes favoured candidate, the promised clean-up successor to the disgraced Blatter era at Fifa, has done what the European football establishment largely opposes. For those who see this as World Cup excellence running to fat, piling one more layer of girth on the current 32-country competition, with a first round in which two countries out of three in 16 groups will qualify, the criticism is obvious.
results.webTitle: Money makes the World Cup go round: more teams means more cash | David Conn

results.firPara: Borussia Dortmund are in talks with Arsenal over a deal for Gedion Zelalem. The Germany-born 19-year-old, who has declared for the United States at international level, was considered to be a future first-team star at Arsenal.
results.secPara: When Arsène Wenger saw Zelalem play for the first time when the midfielder was 14, he told the boys father that he would one day play for Arsenal. That has been proved correct, with Zelalem making his debut for the club two days before his 17th birthday in January 2014.
results.webTitle: Borussia Dortmund in talks with Arsenal over signing of Gedion Zelalem

results.firPara: The 32-team finals since 1998 have felt long enough, but for purely sporting reasons – nothing to do with money – Fifa has decided to add 16 sides and fiddle with the format
results.secPara: Well, its still there last time we checked, and next years tournament in Russia is going ahead as planned. But enjoy the compact, in-no-way-sprawling, 32-team month-long format for only another couple of tournaments. After a vote by the Fifa congress on Tuesday, its going to get a lot bigger.
results.webTitle: How will a 48-team World Cup work? Fifa’s plan for 2026 explained

results.firPara: Crystal Palace have appointed Sammy Lee as their new assistant manager, the Premier League club have announced.
results.secPara: Lee has joined the coaching staff at Selhurst Park, reuniting with new Palace boss Sam Allardyce, who he worked under during their time at Bolton from 2005 until 2007.
results.webTitle: Sammy Lee joins Crystal Palace as assistant manager to Sam Allardyce

results.firPara: In January 1952 Manchester United were on their way to their first top-flight title since 1911 but they met their Marathon at home to Second Division Hull
results.secPara: In January 1952 Manchester United were on their way to their first top-flight title since 1911 but they met their Marathon at home to Second Division Hull
results.webTitle: Hull’s class of 1952 offer current side hope for Manchester United semi
